intro: Jeffreycia amaniensis, commonly known as the Amani Jeffreycia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Tanzania. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils at elevations above 1,500 meters. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as cypsela. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
